title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Crown Heights, Brooklyn

content.rendered:
Marked by brownstones and Victorian mansions, Crown Heights is an evolving area where you’ll find the Caribbean and kosher eateries sharing streets with hip cafes and DJ-fueled bars. Are you planning to move to this trendy neighborhood? Well, before making the big move, here’s your neighborhood guide covering all the key info. Keep it handy for details on average rent and restaurants in Crown Heights that will make your search for rooms for rent in Crown Heights much easier.

1. Where is Crown Heights?

Crown Heights is a neighborhood in the central portion of the New York City borough of Brooklyn. It’s bounded by Washington Avenue to the west, Atlantic Avenue to the north, Ralph Avenue to the east and Empire Boulevard/East New York Avenue to the south. Both native New Yorkers and newcomers to the city love this area’s unique vibes, numerous dining options, and easy access to public transportation.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In East Bronx

2. Find Rooms For Rent in Crown Heights

Find Rooms For Rent In Crown Heights, Brooklyn

Crown Heights was one of Brooklyn’s richest neighborhoods at the turn of the century — as shown by its magnificent architecture — when the newly built A-line drew a slew of Harlem inhabitants to the city in the 1930s. These days, prices and new projects attract a constant stream of working professionals seeking rooms for rent in Crown Heights and quick commutes to Manhattan.

3. Average Rent in Crown Heights

While the buying and the rental markets are becoming increasingly competitive, great value properties are still available. There’s truly something for everyone between grand old townhouses, an influx of new developments, and plenty of multi-family buildings. Many of the residents are families and elite professionals. Moreover, you can easily find a roommate to help you save money on your basic living expenses.

4. Is Crown Heights safe?

Before moving to this new place, you might wonder, ‘is Crown Heights safe’? The northern half of the neighborhood is part of Brooklyn Community District 8 and is patrolled by the 77th Precinct of the NYPD. The southern half is part of District 9 and is patrolled by the 71st Precinct of the NYPD.

Here are a few apps that provide useful neighborhood insights that make the process of finding rooms for rent in Crown Heights hassle-free. Download them before your visit and get access to vital information — for free!

  • Niche: This site provides a comprehensive neighborhood-specific report. It elaborates on various rankings, safety rates, education, real estate and resident reviews.
  • NextDoor: The best way to keep updated about what’s going on in your area is to use NextDoor. It’s a private social network for your neighborhood, where you can exchange safety tips, report suspicious activities, and even arrange a last-minute babysitter.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Jerome Park

  • AroundMe: AroundMe does a great job of helping you find nearby hospitals, supermarkets, pharmacies, and more. Also, it gives you current pricing, directions, and more to help you make a quick choice. It’s an essential app to refer to while looking for rooms for rent in Crown Heights.
  • Hotline Numbers: 911 and 311 are the two helpful numbers New York residents use to get info or for emergencies. Basically, 311 is a type of citizens’ hotline. You can call to report issues like abandoned vehicles, road repairs, noise complaints, and graffiti. By adding a second channel for citizens to report problems, 911 operators are free to address legitimate emergencies.

5. Public Transit in Crown Heights

1. Walkability

This neighborhood is the 60th most walkable neighborhood in New York, with a Walk Score of 95. With parks at every corner, it’s a walker’s paradise! When you live in Crown Heights your daily errands don’t require a car — you can easily get them done by foot.

2. Roads & Traffic

Crown Heights spans a huge cross-section of central Brooklyn, running from the Brooklyn Botanic Garden on one edge, all the way to East New York. It can get loud at times due to the rush, but it’s nothing you won’t get used to in time. You might even come to appreciate the hustle and bustle!

3. Nearby Train Stations

Being familiar with transit options can help you save time when you’re looking for rooms for rent in Crown Heights. The area is served by the New York City Subway’s IRT Eastern Parkway Line with stations at Franklin Avenue (2, 3, 4, and 5 trains), Nostrand Avenue (3 train), Kingston Avenue (3 train), and Utica Avenue (3 and 4 trains).

Related: A Guide To NYC’s Subway Trains

4. Nearby Bus Stops

The following bus lines have routes that pass through the neighborhood: B12, B14, B15, B17, B43, B44, B44 SBS, B45, B46, B46 SBS, B47 and B65.

6. Restaurants in Crown Heights

You’re bound to work up an appetite while you’re out and about looking for rooms for rent in Crown Heights, so don’t forget to explore some of the many restaurants in the neighborhood. There’s a solid mix of established restaurants in Crown Heights and fresh new options, and with limited wait times it’s easy to become a regular (and you’ll get a friendly welcome when you do!).

1. Barboncino

Barboncino is a popular wood-oven pizza spot with a really nice backyard and is a must-try when it comes to restaurants in Crown Heights.

Website
Order Now

2. Pine Tree on Franklin

For sushi, Pine Tree on Franklin is one of the greatest restaurants in Crown Heights! It’s a grocery store with awesome and affordable sushi that’s often called the best in the neighborhood. Eat in or get take out — the choice is yours.

Website

3. Chavela’s

If you’re looking for Mexican food, there aren’t many restaurants in Crown Heights that compare to Chavela’s. Enjoy delicious Mexican fare along with a selection of tequilas, margaritas and other specialty cocktails. Chavela’s is a great spot to unwind after a day spent searching for rooms for rent in Crown Heights.

Website

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn

7. Parks in Crown Heights

In addition to variety of rooms for rent in Crown Heights, this neighborhood also boasts some attractive outdoor spaces like gorgeous greenways where you can look at the city skyline while you enjoy some exciting recreational activities like bike riding, rollerblading or skateboarding.

While you’re in Crown Heights, be sure to check out:

  • Brooklyn Botanic Garden
  • Prospect Park and Mount Prospect Park runs along Crown Heights’ western edge.
  • Brower Park
  • St. John’s Park and Recreation Center

Related: Things To Do In Brooklyn With Your Roommates!

8. Museums near Crown Heights

1. Brooklyn Children’s Museum

The Brooklyn Children’s Museum is a children’s museum near Crown Heights. Founded in 1899, it is the first children’s museum in the United States – and according to some, the first one worldwide.

2. Weeksville Heritage Center

Having museums near potential rooms for rent in Crown Heights is a must for history buffs! The Weeksville Heritage Center is dedicated to the preservation of Weeksville, one of America’s first free black communities during the 19th century.

3. Jewish Children’s Museum

Museums near Crown Heights are plentiful, but the Jewish Children’s Museum stands out because it is the largest Jewish-themed children’s museum in the United States. It aims for children of all faiths and backgrounds to gain a positive perspective. It also aims to develop knowledge of the Jewish heritage, and foster tolerance and understanding.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Crown Heights? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
